page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: MR STAINTHORP IS 83 YEARS OLD AND CAME TO TANFIELD IN 1918. HE TOLD US THAT THE ROADS WERE JUST GRAVEL AND SOIL IN THOSE DAYS. EVENTUALLY THE HEADMASTER COMPLAINED ABOUT THE DUSTY CONDITIONS. MR STAINTHORP WORKED AT THE THE GRANGE AND LIVED THERE UNTIL HE GOT MARRIED. HE STARTED WORK AT 5.30AM. BY FEEDING THE CATTLE AND HORSES, THEN HE WOULD HAVE BREAKFAST OF COLD BACON, A ROLL AND HALF A TEA-CAKE, THEN HE WOULD PLOUGH THE FIELDS. IT COULD TAKE HIM A WHOLE DAY TO PLOUGH AN ACRE. IN THE MORNING, A TRAIN WOULD GO FROM TANFIELD TO RIPON,MAKING SEVERAL JOURNIES. CHILDREN CAUGHT THE TRAIN AT 7.00AM. TO GO TO SCHOOL IN RIPON. MOST PEOPLE OWNED A PONY AND TRAP OR BICYCLE. THERE WERE SEVERAL SHOPS IN THE VILLAGE, INCLUDING A TAILOR;COBBLER;GROCER;BOOTMAKER AND BUTCHER.
